name: unapparent
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not easy to see, recognize, or understand: Two thirds of the patients may already have been suffering mild, clinically unapparent lung disease. This would happen so quickly that it would be unapparent to an outside observer. Opposite
apparent
More examplesFewer examplesWe consider the role of routine blood cultures in detecting unapparent infections. For some people, their first anxiety symptoms were not caused by any specific encounter but rather by the unapparent build-up of stress.A careful data search may reveal other, otherwise unapparent aspects of how the system was used and how data was generated.
